se.lypson.common.io
Class LineReader

java.lang.Object
  java.io.InputStream
      se.lypson.common.io.LineReader

public class LineReader
extends java.io.InputStream

Adds line-reading capabilities to an input stream. The characters are expected to be single-byte (ASCII) encoded and a single line of text is expected to be terminated by either a carriage return ('\r') followed immediately by a line feed ('\n') or a single line feed.

This is an implementation of the Decorator Pattern.

Author:
Tobias Persson

Method Detail

readLine

public java.lang.String readLine()
                          throws java.io.IOException

Read a line of text. A line is considered to be terminated by a carriage return ('\r') followed immediately by a line feed ('\n'), a single line feed, or the end of the stream, whichever comes first. The end of line characters or the end of file character is not added to the returned string.

All characters are expected to be single-byte (ASCII) encoded.

Returns:
A line of text
Throws:
java.io.EOFException - thrown if no characters can be read because the end of file is reached, but not if characters are read before the end of file is reached
java.io.IOException - thrown if an I/O error occurs.

read

public int read()
         throws java.io.IOException
Reads the next byte of data from the input stream specified as argument to the constructor.

Specified by:
read in class java.io.InputStream
Returns:
The next byte of data, or -1 if the end of the stream is reached
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if an I/O error occurs.
